home.title: Home
home.summary_01: The Ordinals X protocol (ordx protocol) is a "Satoshi Standard" Fungible Token issuance protocol based on the Ordinals protocol. It involves numbering and inscribing sats, one token one satoshi, creating a permanent binding and cannot be destroyed.
home.summary_02: The ordx protocol is the world's first protocol to break through the UTXO model and delve into a deeper layer. By precisely locating and manipulating BTC's fundamental unit, "Satoshi", the ordx protocol gains immense power, addressing issues such as spam creation, difficulty in splitting, and vulnerability to destruction.
home.summary_03: The ordx assets will freely flow throughout the entire BTC network, whether on the first layer or second layer. This is because Satoshi is BTC, and Satoshi carries permanently bound ordx assets.
home.pearl_02: We have officially deployed the first Token of the protocol: Pearl on January 25, 2024.
home.pearl_04: The Pearl minting process has been completed, spanning from block height 828200 to 828800, lasting four days. The valid minting inscription serial numbers range from 59088177 to 59800871, totaling 15528 successful mintings. This fair minting process involved 657 community members. Due to the presence of counterfeit Pearls in the market, we kindly urge everyone to verify the authenticity of the asset corresponding to the inscription serial number here before engaging in any transactions, to avoid falling victim to fraud.
home.jade_02: Only the first sat of each block can successfully mint. In the future, each token is worth 1-10 BTC.
home.sapphire_02: Only sats with rare attributes can be minted into sapphires, and there are only 3437 sapphires at most. There are currently less than 400 of them, and each is expected to be worth 100 BTC.
home.ruby_02: Only sats with epic attributes can be minted into rubies, and there are only a maximum of 32 rubies. There are currently only 3, each expected to be worth 10,000 BTC.
home.gold_02: Mint can only succeed with the first sat of each BTC, that is, the sat serial number ends with 8 zeros.
home.gold_03: This means that each token is worth 1 BTC.
home.tb_row02_col02: ord based envelope writing to segregated witness zone
home.tb_row02_col03: ord based envelope writing to segregated witness zone
home.tb_row03_col02: Depends on ord indexer, ordx indexer provides convenience
home.tb_row03_col03: Depends on ord and brc-20 indexer
home.tb_row03_col04: Depends on ord and electrumx indexer
home.tb_row04_col02: Verified by ordx indexer, client-side verification is possible
home.tb_row04_col03: Verified by brc-20 indexer, client-side verification is impossible
home.tb_row04_col04: Verified by the electrumx indexer, theoretically client-side verification is possible
home.tb_row06_col02: One asset, one sat, strongly bound and unchangeable
home.tb_row08_col02: Sat cannot be burned, and ordx assets cannot be burned.
home.tb_row08_col04: Using the wrong wallet or using it in the wrong way can easily cause the token to be burned.

files.name: Files
files.upload_des_1: Drag and drop your files here, or click to select files

text.name: Text
text.single_des: If single, we will inscribe exactly what is there
text.bulk_des: If bulk, we will inscribe one for every new line.

ordx.name: OrdX
ordx.cn_placeholder: For example, cn=1000, 1000 consecutively numbered sats
ordx.trz_placeholder: For example, trz=8, it means that the sat number has 8 zeros at the end.
ordx.block_helper: The effective time of mint is approximately from {{start}} to {{end}}.
ordx.error_2: Deploy must have Block or Rarity or Regular Expression
ordx.error_5: Mint amount must be less than {{limit}}
ordx.error_8: {{tick}} contains special sat and cannot be cast
ordx.rarity_helper: Special sat attributes required for mint.
